title: Facebook usage frequency in the United States 2018 , by ethnicity
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Frequencys for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, White had the highest Share of respondents in Frequency At least once a day and Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
In Frequency At least once a day, Other had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Frequency Don't know/No opinion out of all 7 Frequencys.
Frequency At least once a day and Don't know/No opinion had the biggest gap of 47.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Other.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 7 different Frequencys on X-axis for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.

Frequency At least once a day had the maximum Share of respondents among all 4 groups, and it was for White. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Frequency Don't know/No opinion for Hispanic.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Frequencys for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, White had the highest Share of respondents in Frequency At least once a day and Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
In Frequency At least once a day, Other had the maximum Share of respondents and it saw the lowest in Frequency Don't know/No opinion out of all 7 Frequencys.
Frequency At least once a day and Don't know/No opinion had the biggest gap of 47.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Other.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 7 different Frequencys on X-axis for 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 4 groups, White had the highest Share of respondents in Frequency At least once a day and Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
Among all the Frequencys, Other had the highest Share of respondents in Frequency At least once a day and lowest Share of respondents in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
The maximum Share of respondents for Other that was found in Frequency At least once a day was 24.5 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Frequency Don't know/No opinion.
Among the groups, White had the biggest difference in Share of respondents. Where the maximum Share of respondents was 32.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents.

In Frequency At least once a day, White had the highest Share of respondents 64.0 among the 4 groups and in Don't know/No opinion, Hispanic had the lowest Share of respondents 1.0. The second highest Share of respondents 53.0 was observed for White in Frequency At least once a day.
Averaging all 4 groups White, Hispanic, Black, and Other, the Frequency At least once a day is the maximum Share of respondents and Don't know/No opinion is the minimum Share of respondents.
